description: The tmnxClear notification is generated to report the results
of the clear function that was run as a result of setting

Summary.eval: ($v4==1) ? 'Clear function ($v1) completed successfully' : 'Clear function ($v1) failed due to $v5'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClear TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearName s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearParams s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearLastClearedTime t 31536000 TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearResult i 1 TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearErrorText s EXAMPLE

description: The name of the application clear function associated with this
variables.name: TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearName

description: The tmnxClearParams string is a sequence of parameter name
value pairs to be used to determine the managed object to
which to apply the application clear function associated with
variables.name: TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearParams

description: The tmnxClearLastClearedTime variable contains the sysUpTime
value when tmnxClearAction was last set to 'doAction (1)' to
run the application clear function associated with this row entry.
variables.name: TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearLastClearedTime

description: The result of the last attempt to enact the application clear
function associated with this row entry.
variables.name: TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearResult

description: If the result of the last attempt to enact the application clear
function associated with this row entry failed, tmnxClearResult is
'failure (2)', tmnxClearErrorText contains a text string to further
explain the cause of the failure.
variables.name: TIMETRA-CLEAR-MIB::tmnxClearErrorText
